title: Newcastle urged to be positive as Rafa Benitez looks to get Premier League promotion bid back on track
text:
Newcastle urged to be positive as Rafa Benitez looks to get Premier League promotion bid back on track The Geordies have crashed to four defeats in their last eight games Share Promotion chasing Newcastle have suffered a slump in form (Photo: Serena Taylor) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Rafa Benitez has urged calm despite promotion favourites Newcastle being hit for seven defeats. 
The Geordies have crashed to four defeats in their last eight games, yet have won more games this season, and scored more goals, than any other team. 
Newcastle have won 17 but only drawn one, and Benitez wants tough games to be turned into stalemate instead of losses. 
The last time United were promoted in May 2010 they lost only four games all season on their way to 102 points. 
Last season Burnley lost only five games on their way to 93 points. The Geordies have crashed to four defeats in their last eight games (Photo: Serena Taylor) 
But analysis of the last ten seasons Championship champions, shows Sunderland lost 12, West Brom 11, Reading 11 and Wolves 10, and all finished top. 
Defender Paul Dummett admits Newcastle, who lost 1-0 to Blackburn on Monday, were frustrated at dominating the chances at Ewood Park but losing. 
He said: “It’s very frustrating. The manager just said we’ve got to be positive, as we dominated the game. 
“It’s disappointing, and coming here away is a tough place to come. Rafa Benitez is urging Newcastle to remain positive (Photo: Getty Images) Read More Newcastle plot loan swoop for Everton's Tom Cleverley with eye to permanent deal 
“We’ve struggled a few times I think in a few of the games where we’ve had the same situation, and we just need to finish things off when we get the chances. 
“The performance was really good – we’ve had a lot of chances and dominated the game and we haven’t got the result we deserved, but that’s football. 
“You’ve got to take your chances when you get them and finish teams off.” Last 10 Champions of The Championship
